title: MSX BASIC Programming Reference
description: Comprehensive reference documentation for MSX BASIC programming language commands, functions, statements, and procedures. Covers all standard MSX BASIC commands, mathematical functions, string operations, I/O operations, graphics commands, sound functions, and system calls.

toc.title: ABS() - Absolute Value Function
toc.description: Returns the absolute value of a numeric expression. Converts negative numbers to positive while leaving positive numbers unchanged.

toc.title: AND - Logical AND Operator
toc.description: Performs logical AND operation between two expressions. Returns true only when both operands are true.

toc.title: ASC() - ASCII Code Function
toc.description: Returns the ASCII code value of the first character in a string expression.

toc.title: ATN() - Arctangent Function
toc.description: Returns the arctangent (inverse tangent) of a numeric expression in radians.

toc.title: AUTO - Automatic Line Numbering
toc.description: Automatically generates line numbers when entering BASIC program lines, with optional increment values.

toc.title: BASE() - Numeric Base Function
toc.description: Function for working with different numeric bases and base conversions in MSX BASIC.

toc.title: BEEP - Sound Beep Command
toc.description: Produces a simple beep sound through the MSX sound system.

toc.title: BIN$() - Binary String Function
toc.description: Converts a numeric value to its binary string representation.

toc.title: BLOAD - Binary Load Command
toc.description: Loads binary data from tape or disk into memory at a specified address.

toc.title: BSAVE - Binary Save Command
toc.description: Saves a block of memory as binary data to tape or disk.

toc.title: CALL - Machine Language Call
toc.description: Calls a machine language subroutine at a specified memory address.

toc.title: CALL ADJUST - Screen Adjustment
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for adjusting screen position and display parameters.

toc.title: CALL IMPOSE - Image Overlay
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for overlaying images and graphics on the screen.

toc.title: CALL OPTIONS - System Options
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for setting various system options and configurations.

toc.title: CALL PAUSE - Execution Pause
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for pausing program execution.

toc.title: CALL PCMPLAY - PCM Playback
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for playing PCM audio data.

toc.title: CALL PCMREC - PCM Recording
toc.description: MSX2+ specific command for recording PCM audio data.

toc.title: CDBL() - Convert to Double Precision
toc.description: Converts a numeric expression to double precision floating point format.

toc.title: CHR$() - Character Function
toc.description: Returns the character corresponding to a given ASCII code value.

toc.title: CINT() - Convert to Integer
toc.description: Converts a numeric expression to integer format by rounding to the nearest whole number.

toc.title: CIRCLE - Draw Circle Command
toc.description: Draws circles, ellipses, arcs, and sectors on the graphics screen.

toc.title: CLEAR - Clear Variables Command
toc.description: Clears all variables and sets aside space for string storage and stack.

toc.title: CLOAD - Cassette Load Command
toc.description: Loads a BASIC program from cassette tape into memory.

toc.title: CLOAD? - Verify Cassette Load
toc.description: Verifies a BASIC program on cassette tape against the program in memory.

toc.title: CLOSE - Close File Command
toc.description: Closes one or more open files and frees file numbers for reuse.

toc.title: CLS - Clear Screen Command
toc.description: Clears the screen and homes the cursor to the upper-left corner.

toc.title: COLOR - Set Color Command
toc.description: Sets the foreground, background, and border colors for text and graphics modes.

toc.title: COLOR= - Color Palette Assignment
toc.description: MSX2/2+ command for setting color palette entries with RGB values.

toc.title: COLOR_SPRITE$() - Sprite Color String Function
toc.description: MSX2/2+ function that returns sprite color information as a string.

toc.title: COLOR_SPRITE() - Sprite Color Function
toc.description: MSX2/2+ function that returns sprite color information.

toc.title: CONT - Continue Execution
toc.description: Continues program execution after a STOP command or break.

toc.title: COPY - Screen Copy Command
toc.description: Copies screen content to printer or other output device.

toc.title: COPY_SCREEN - Screen Copy Function
toc.description: MSX2/2+ command for copying screen areas between video pages.

toc.title: COS() - Cosine Function
toc.description: Returns the cosine of an angle expressed in radians.

toc.title: CSAVE - Cassette Save Command
toc.description: Saves the current BASIC program to cassette tape.

toc.title: CSNG() - Convert to Single Precision
toc.description: Converts a numeric expression to single precision floating point format.

toc.title: CSRLIN - Cursor Line Function
toc.description: Returns the current line position of the cursor on the screen.

toc.title: DATA - Data Statement
toc.description: Stores numeric and string constants that can be accessed by READ statements.

toc.title: DEFDBL - Define Double Precision
toc.description: Declares that variables starting with specified letters are double precision by default.

toc.title: DEFINT - Define Integer
toc.description: Declares that variables starting with specified letters are integers by default.

toc.title: DEFSNG - Define Single Precision
toc.description: Declares that variables starting with specified letters are single precision by default.

toc.title: DEFSTR - Define String
toc.description: Declares that variables starting with specified letters are strings by default.

toc.title: DEF FN - Define Function
toc.description: Defines a user-defined function that can be called later in the program.

toc.title: DEF USR - Define User Routine
toc.description: Defines the starting address of a machine language routine accessible via USR function.

toc.title: DELETE - Delete Lines Command
toc.description: Deletes specified lines from the current BASIC program.

toc.title: DIM - Dimension Arrays
toc.description: Declares and allocates space for arrays with specified dimensions.

toc.title: DRAW - Draw Graphics Command
toc.description: Draws complex graphics using a string of drawing commands (macro language).

toc.title: ELSE - Conditional Else
toc.description: Provides alternative execution path in IF...THEN...ELSE conditional statements.

toc.title: END - End Program
toc.description: Terminates program execution and returns control to command mode.

toc.title: EOF() - End of File Function
toc.description: Returns true if the end of a file has been reached during file operations.

toc.title: EQV - Logical Equivalence
toc.description: Performs logical equivalence operation between two expressions.

toc.title: ERASE - Erase Arrays
toc.description: Erases arrays and frees the memory space they occupied.

toc.title: ERL - Error Line Function
toc.description: Returns the line number where the last error occurred.

toc.title: ERR - Error Code Function
toc.description: Returns the error code of the last error that occurred.

toc.title: ERROR - Generate Error
toc.description: Generates a specified error condition for testing error handling routines.

toc.title: EXP() - Exponential Function
toc.description: Returns e raised to the power of the specified expression.

toc.title: FIELD - Define Record Fields
toc.description: Defines string variables to access portions of a random access file record.

toc.title: FIX() - Fix Function
toc.description: Returns the integer portion of a number by truncating the decimal part.

toc.title: FN - User-Defined Function Call
toc.description: Calls a user-defined function previously defined with DEF FN.

toc.title: FOR...NEXT - Loop Structure
toc.description: Creates a counting loop that repeats a block of statements a specified number of times.

toc.title: FRE() - Free Memory Function
toc.description: Returns the amount of available memory in bytes.

toc.title: GET_DATE - Get System Date
toc.description: MSX2+ command that retrieves the current system date.

toc.title: GET_TIME - Get System Time
toc.description: MSX2+ command that retrieves the current system time.

toc.title: GOSUB - Goto Subroutine
toc.description: Calls a subroutine at a specified line number and remembers the return location.

toc.title: GOTO - Goto Statement
toc.description: Transfers program control unconditionally to a specified line number.

toc.title: HEX$() - Hexadecimal String Function
toc.description: Converts a numeric value to its hexadecimal string representation.

toc.title: IF...GOTO...ELSE - Conditional Goto
toc.description: Conditional statement that transfers control to specified line numbers based on condition.

toc.title: IF...THEN...ELSE - Conditional Statement
toc.description: Conditional statement that executes different code blocks based on logical conditions.

toc.title: IMP - Logical Implication
toc.description: Performs logical implication operation between two expressions.

toc.title: INKEY$ - Input Key Function
toc.description: Returns the character of a key pressed on the keyboard without waiting.

toc.title: INP() - Input Port Function
toc.description: Reads a byte value from a specified I/O port.

toc.title: INPUT$() - Input String Function
toc.description: Reads a specified number of characters from keyboard or file.

toc.title: INPUT - Input Statement
toc.description: Accepts input from keyboard or file and assigns values to variables.

toc.title: INSTR() - String Search Function
toc.description: Searches for the position of a substring within a string.

toc.title: INT() - Integer Function
toc.description: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified value.

toc.title: INTERVAL - Set Timer Interval
toc.description: Sets the interval for the timer interrupt used with ON INTERVAL GOSUB.

toc.title: KEY() - Function Key Status
toc.description: Returns the status of function keys and other special keys.

toc.title: KEY - Key Assignment
toc.description: Assigns strings to function keys and controls key display.

toc.title: LEFT$() - Left String Function
toc.description: Returns a specified number of characters from the left side of a string.

toc.title: LEN() - String Length Function
toc.description: Returns the number of characters in a string expression.

toc.title: LET - Assignment Statement
toc.description: Assigns a value to a variable. The LET keyword is optional in most cases.

toc.title: LINE - Draw Line Command
toc.description: Draws lines, rectangles, and filled boxes on the graphics screen.

toc.title: LINE INPUT - Line Input Statement
toc.description: Reads an entire line of input including commas and quotation marks.

toc.title: LIST - List Program
toc.description: Displays the current BASIC program or specified line ranges on screen.

toc.title: LLIST - List to Printer
toc.description: Prints the current BASIC program or specified line ranges to printer.

toc.title: LOAD - Load Program
toc.description: Loads a BASIC program from disk or tape into memory.

toc.title: LOCATE - Position Cursor
toc.description: Positions the text cursor at specified column and row coordinates.

toc.title: LOG() - Natural Logarithm Function
toc.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a specified value.

toc.title: LPOS() - Printer Position Function
toc.description: Returns the current print head position on the printer.

toc.title: LPRINT - Print to Printer
toc.description: Sends formatted output directly to the printer.

toc.title: MAXFILES - Set Maximum Files
toc.description: Sets the maximum number of files that can be open simultaneously.

toc.title: MERGE - Merge Programs
toc.description: Merges a BASIC program from disk or tape with the program currently in memory.

toc.title: MID$() - Middle String Function
toc.description: Returns a substring from the middle of a string expression.

toc.title: MOD - Modulo Operator
toc.description: Returns the remainder of integer division between two numbers.

toc.title: MOTOR - Cassette Motor Control
toc.description: Controls the cassette tape motor for tape operations.

toc.title: NEW - Clear Program
toc.description: Erases the current program and variables from memory.

toc.title: NOT - Logical NOT Operator
toc.description: Performs logical negation on an expression, inverting true/false values.

toc.title: OCT$() - Octal String Function
toc.description: Converts a numeric value to its octal string representation.

toc.title: ON...GOSUB - Conditional Subroutine Call
toc.description: Calls one of several subroutines based on the value of an expression.

toc.title: ON...GOTO - Conditional Branch
toc.description: Transfers control to one of several line numbers based on expression value.

toc.title: ON ERROR GOTO - Error Handling
toc.description: Sets up error handling by specifying where to branch when errors occur.

toc.title: ON INTERVAL GOSUB - Timer Interrupt
toc.description: Sets up a timer interrupt that calls a subroutine at regular intervals.

toc.title: ON KEY GOSUB - Key Interrupt
toc.description: Sets up key press interrupts that call subroutines when specific keys are pressed.

toc.title: ON SPRITE GOSUB - Sprite Interrupt
toc.description: Sets up sprite collision interrupts that call subroutines when sprites collide.

toc.title: ON STOP GOSUB - Stop Key Interrupt
toc.description: Sets up interrupt handling for the STOP key press.

toc.title: ON STRIG GOSUB - Trigger Interrupt
toc.description: Sets up trigger/joystick button interrupts that call subroutines.

toc.title: OPEN - Open File
toc.description: Opens a file for input, output, or random access operations.

toc.title: OR - Logical OR Operator
toc.description: Performs logical OR operation between two expressions.

toc.title: OUT - Output to Port
toc.description: Sends a byte value to a specified I/O port.

toc.title: PAD() - Touchpad Function
toc.description: Returns the status of touchpad coordinates and buttons.

toc.title: PAINT - Paint Fill Command
toc.description: Fills an enclosed area on the graphics screen with a specified color or pattern.

toc.title: PDL() - Paddle Function
toc.description: Returns the analog value of paddle controllers connected to the MSX.

toc.title: PEEK() - Memory Peek Function
toc.description: Returns the byte value stored at a specified memory address.

toc.title: PLAY() - Music Status Function
toc.description: Returns the number of notes remaining in the music buffer for specified sound channel.

toc.title: PLAY - Music Play Command
toc.description: Plays music using Music Macro Language (MML) strings on PSG sound channels.

toc.title: POINT - Point Function
toc.description: Returns the color of a pixel at specified coordinates on the graphics screen.

toc.title: POKE - Memory Poke Command
toc.description: Stores a byte value at a specified memory address.

toc.title: POS() - Print Position Function
toc.description: Returns the current column position of the cursor or print head.

toc.title: PRESET - Reset Pixel Command
toc.description: Sets a pixel to the background color at specified coordinates.

toc.title: PRINT - Print Statement
toc.description: Displays text, numbers, and expressions on screen or sends data to files. Can be abbreviated as '?'.

toc.title: PSET - Set Pixel Command
toc.description: Sets a pixel to a specified color at given coordinates on the graphics screen.

toc.title: PUT_KANJI - Display Kanji Character
toc.description: MSX2+ command for displaying Kanji characters from the Kanji ROM.

toc.title: PUT_SPRITE - Put Sprite Command
toc.description: Displays a sprite at specified coordinates with given pattern and attributes.

toc.title: READ - Read Data Statement
toc.description: Reads values from DATA statements and assigns them to variables.

toc.title: REM - Remark Statement
toc.description: Indicates a comment or remark in the program. Text after REM is ignored during execution.

toc.title: RENUM - Renumber Lines
toc.description: Renumbers the lines of the current BASIC program with new increment values.

toc.title: RESTORE - Restore Data Pointer
toc.description: Resets the data pointer to the beginning of DATA statements or to a specified line.

toc.title: RESUME - Resume After Error
toc.description: Resumes program execution after an error handling routine.

toc.title: RETURN - Return from Subroutine
toc.description: Returns control from a subroutine to the statement following the GOSUB call.

toc.title: RIGHT$() - Right String Function
toc.description: Returns a specified number of characters from the right side of a string.

toc.title: RND() - Random Number Function
toc.description: Returns a random number between 0 and 1, or within a specified range.

toc.title: RUN - Run Program
toc.description: Starts execution of the current BASIC program, optionally from a specified line.

toc.title: SAVE - Save Program
toc.description: Saves the current BASIC program to disk or tape.

toc.title: SCREEN - Set Screen Mode
toc.description: Sets the video display mode, determining resolution, colors, and graphics capabilities.

toc.title: SET_ADJUST - Set Screen Adjustment
toc.description: MSX2+ command for adjusting screen position and display parameters.

toc.title: SET_BEEP - Set Beep Parameters
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting beep sound parameters.

toc.title: SET_DATE - Set System Date
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting the system date.

toc.title: SET_PAGE - Set Video Page
toc.description: MSX2/2+ command for setting active and visible video pages.

toc.title: SET_PASSWORD - Set Password
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting system password protection.

toc.title: SET_PROMPT - Set Command Prompt
toc.description: MSX2+ command for customizing the command prompt.

toc.title: SET_SCREEN - Set Screen Parameters
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting various screen parameters and modes.

toc.title: SET_SCROLL - Set Scroll Parameters
toc.description: MSX2/2+ command for setting hardware scrolling parameters.

toc.title: SET_TIME - Set System Time
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting the system time.

toc.title: SET_TITLE - Set Screen Title
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting screen title text.

toc.title: SET_VIDEO - Set Video Parameters
toc.description: MSX2+ command for setting video output parameters.

toc.title: SGN() - Sign Function
toc.description: Returns the sign of a number: -1 for negative, 0 for zero, +1 for positive.

toc.title: SIN() - Sine Function
toc.description: Returns the sine of an angle expressed in radians.

toc.title: SOUND - Sound Command
toc.description: Generates sounds by directly controlling PSG sound chip registers.

toc.title: SPACE$() - Space String Function
toc.description: Returns a string consisting of a specified number of space characters.

toc.title: SPC() - Space Print Function
toc.description: Prints a specified number of spaces in PRINT statements.

toc.title: SPRITE$() - Sprite String Function
toc.description: Returns sprite pattern data as a string for manipulation and storage.

toc.title: SPRITE - Sprite Command
toc.description: Controls sprite attributes including position, color, and pattern.

toc.title: SQR() - Square Root Function
toc.description: Returns the square root of a specified numeric expression.

toc.title: STICK() - Joystick Function
toc.description: Returns the direction status of joystick controllers.

toc.title: STOP - Stop Program
toc.description: Halts program execution and displays 'Break in [line number]' message.

toc.title: STR$() - String Conversion Function
toc.description: Converts a numeric value to its string representation.

toc.title: STRIG() - Trigger Function
toc.description: Returns the status of joystick trigger buttons and mouse buttons.

toc.title: STRING$() - Repeat String Function
toc.description: Returns a string consisting of a character repeated a specified number of times.

toc.title: SWAP - Swap Variables
toc.description: Exchanges the values of two variables of the same type.

toc.title: TAB() - Tab Print Function
toc.description: Moves the cursor to a specified column position in PRINT statements.

toc.title: TAN() - Tangent Function
toc.description: Returns the tangent of an angle expressed in radians.

toc.title: TIME - System Time Variable
toc.description: System variable that holds the current time in seconds since midnight.

toc.title: TROFF - Trace Off
toc.description: Turns off program trace mode that displays line numbers during execution.

toc.title: TRON - Trace On
toc.description: Turns on program trace mode that displays line numbers as they execute.

toc.title: USR() - User Function Call
toc.description: Calls a machine language routine and returns a value.

toc.title: VAL() - Value Function
toc.description: Converts a string representation of a number to its numeric value.

toc.title: VARPTR() - Variable Pointer Function
toc.description: Returns the memory address where a variable is stored.

toc.title: VDP() - Video Display Processor Function
toc.description: Reads from VDP (Video Display Processor) status and control registers.

toc.title: VPEEK() - Video Memory Peek Function
toc.description: Returns a byte value from Video RAM (VRAM) at specified address.

toc.title: VPOKE - Video Memory Poke Command
toc.description: Stores a byte value in Video RAM (VRAM) at specified address.

toc.title: WAIT - Wait Command
toc.description: Suspends program execution until a specified I/O port condition is met.

toc.title: WIDTH - Set Screen Width
toc.description: Sets the character width of the screen display and printer output.

toc.title: XOR - Logical XOR Operator
toc.description: Performs logical exclusive OR operation between two expressions.
